div.p: Your much esteem'd Favour of the 14th. of April I received in Course of Post. — As to your first Query, the number of Souls in Lismore alone is about 1500; but Lismore is but a Part of my Parish which in whole exceeds 42 computed Miles in Length from the one Extremity to the other with the Country of Glenco included which is a part of my Parish, besides 9 computed Miles upon the Continent of Kingerloch. — Our Inhabitants are surely upon the Decrease; they are so particularly upon the main Land because many of the Farms are now occupied with Sheep & more of them will soon be laid out in that way — As to your 2nd. Query, we export no Corn or Grain of any Kind; not even from this Island except a considerable Quantity of Bear, which (as I hinted in my last to you) is distill'd into Spirits & several Hundred Bolls of that Commodity are yearly sold in the neighbouring Countries of Lorn, mull, Appin, Lochaber & Ardgour — There is an immense Quantity of Meal yearly imported into most parts of Argyleshire; even in the Island they buy a great Quantity as most of the meal of the Island goes to pay the Landlords — It has been computed that some years above above thirty Thousand Bolls of Meal have been imported to Argyleshire from Ireland & the north of Scotland —

As to your third Query, its not very easy ascertaining the Number of black Cattle annually sold off, as they are disposed off sometimes in year olds, sometimes in two years olds, & that not in parcels or Numbers, but one or two at a Time — Perhaps there may be about a Hundred sold yearly from the Island; its difficult to ascertain their Prices as they are of very different Qualities. Their year-olds sell from fifteen to thirty Shillings each; Their two year-olds from thirty to forty Shillings; their three year-olds from 40/ to three pounds & so on. — I am greatly obliged to you for the prints which seem to be extreamly well execute. —
There is a Society of Highland Clergymen, that have lately come to a Resolution to write a Grammar & Dictionary of the Galic Language; the Work is to be immediately set about. —

closer.salute:
I am, with much Esteem,
Sir,
Your much obliged humble
Servt.
